Preaching of John the Baptist
The*p beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

The*sln voice*s of*s one*s crying*s in*s the*s wilderness,*s ‘Make*sln ready*s the*s way*s of*s the*s Lord,*s Make*sln His*s paths*s straight*s .’ ”
John*p the Baptist appeared in the wilderness preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
And all the country of Judea was going out to him, and all the people of Jerusalem; and they were being baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.

I baptized you with water; but He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”

In*p those days Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
Immediately coming up out of the water, He saw the heavens opening, and the Spirit like a dove descending upon Him;

They*p went into Capernaum; and immediately on the Sabbath He entered the synagogue and began*i to teach.

Mark 2
The Paralytic Healed
When*p He had come back to Capernaum several days afterward, it was heard that He was at home.
And many were gathered together, so that there was no longer room, not even near the door; and He was speaking the word to them.
And they came, bringing to Him a paralytic, carried by four men.
Being unable to get to Him because of the crowd, they removed the roof above Him; and when they had dug an opening, they let down the pallet on which the paralytic was lying.
And Jesus seeing their faith said to the paralytic, “Son,*r your*r sins*r are*r forgiven.”*r

Immediately Jesus, aware in His spirit that they were reasoning that way within themselves, said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r reasoning*r about*r these*r things*r in*r your*r hearts?*r
Which*r is*r easier,*r to*r say*r to*r the*r paralytic,*r ‘Your*r sins*r are*r forgiven’;*r or*r to*r say,*r ‘Get*r up,*r and*r pick*r up*r your*r pallet*r and*r walk’?*r

Explanation

Jesus Stills the Sea
On*p that day, when evening came, He said to them, “Let*r us*r go*r over*r to*r the*r other*r side.”*r

Mark 5
The Gerasene Demoniac
They*p came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gerasenes.
When He got out of the boat, immediately a man from the tombs with an unclean spirit met Him,
and he had his dwelling among the tombs. And no one was able to bind him anymore, even with a chain;
because he had often been bound with shackles and chains, and the chains had been torn apart by him and the shackles broken in pieces, and no one was strong enough to subdue him.

and shouting with a loud voice, he said, “What business do we have with each other, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I implore You by God, do not torment me!”

The*i demons*i implored Him, saying, “Send us into the swine so that we may enter them.”

Jesus gave them permission. And coming out, the unclean spirits entered the swine; and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the sea, about two thousand of*i them;*i and they were drowned in the sea.

Miracles and Healing
When*p Jesus had crossed over again in the boat to the other side, a large crowd gathered around Him; and so He stayed by the seashore.
